item.title: Notes on Go concurrency
item.description: Concurrent computing is a form of computing in which several computations are executed during overlapping time periods—concurrently—instead of sequentially (one completing before the next starts). This is a property of a system—this may be an individual program, a computer, or a network—and there is a separate execution point or “thread of control” for each computation (“process”). A concurrent system is one where a computation can advance without waiting for all other computations to complete
